Section 1 Woman:  Good morning, Fairview Real Estate Agency.  How can I help you? Man:   Yes, good morning, I’m phoning about some properties that you’re advertising… W:   Ok, are you thinking of buying, or a rental property? M:   To rent…, I want to rent a house. W:  Ok, well…,    we have a number of properties for rent.  Do you know the general area you’re interested in? M:   Yes, we’d like to be on the north side of the city, but close to the downtown area, or at least with good public transportation. W:   Alright, yes, we have some nice houses in Northbridge, that’s a great area.  Are you looking for a house or an apartment? M:   A house.  It’s for my wife and I, and our son.  He’s starting school this year, so that’s another requirement…, we’d like to be near a primary school, if we could. W:   That shouldn’t be a problem. There are a couple of good schools in Northbridge, and also in Meadowvale, which is the next suburb.  What kind of house are you looking for? M:   Well, three bedrooms, I want to set up an office in the third bedroom.  I do a lot of work from home you see. W:   Ok. M:   Oh, and a garage…, a 2-car garage, if possible. W:   Alright.  I’ll type that into the computer and see what we have.  Do you have any other requirements? M:   Well, of course we want a kitchen and living area, but we would also like two bathrooms if possible. We would also like a garden, but it would have to have a fence. W:   Right, I’ve got that. Now, do you have any pets…? M:   No, no we don’t. W:   That’s good – some landlords don’t allow pets in the house. Anything else? M:   Well, we’re new to this city, so I don’t know a lot about Northbridge. Is there much to do there? W:   Well, there’s a big shopping mall, and it has a huge cinema complex with about eight theatres, I think.  It’s close to the beach, but the aquarium is not in Northbridge, unfortunately. M:   That’s OK, I don’t think we’d go to the aquarium that often.  What about sports facilities - say, a golf course…? W:   There’s Lincoln Park, that’s nice, but no golf course, I’m afraid.  There’s the Northbridge Tennis Centre, and the public swimming pool is in Meadowvale. M:   Well, it sounds like a very nice area. W:   Great.  I think the best thing is for me to get your details, and then let’s make a time for you to come in, and we can speak in more detail, and possibly we can show you one or two of the houses that we have. M:   Yes, that sounds like a good idea.   Before you continue, you have some time to look at questions 6 – 10.     * pause * Now, listen carefully, and answer questions 6 – 10.    W:   Now, first of all, can you tell me your name? M:   My name is Doug Norcross, that’s N – O – R – C – R – O – double S. W:   Ok, Doug… Norcross…, got it.  And your address at the moment? M:   Well, we’re just in temporary accommodation, we’re staying at 455 Second Avenue.  In Garden Town. W:   That’s a nice area. M:   Yes, yes it is.  But, we need something more permanent.  Do you want my phone number? W:   Yes, I was just about to ask you.  Can I have your mobile phone number? M:   Ok, my mobile is 0 – 4 – 6… 3 – 1 – 1… 2 – 1 – 7 – 8. W:   That was 0 4 6 3 1 2 1 7 8…? M:   No, 0 4 6… 3 – double 1… W:   Ok, 0 4 6 3 1 1 2 1 7 8.  Got it. M:   Good.  Now, when can I come in?  I can come in to tomorrow or Tuesday, if that’s convenient.  We’d really like to get something soon. W:   Tuesday is good.  How about 10 a.m.? M:   Sure. Oh - can we make it at 11?  I have another appointment first thing in the morning, and I wouldn’t want to be late to see you. W:   No problem, 11 o’clock it is, then.  Now, what kind of price range are you looking for?  In Northbridge, properties can go as high as 600 pounds a week. M:   Well, we’d be looking at something a little less than that. The most we want to pay is 500 pounds a week range, but we could go as high as 550 pounds if we had to. W:   Ok… I’ve booked you in to see Charlotte Gardner – she’s our rental property expert, so we’ll see you on Tuesday…   (fade) ….
